page.title: 11CHANGING TIMES - by BEN
page.content: { Arkengarthdale}has changed little in appearance in the last{100 years.}No new houses have been built and all electricity cables are underground. One major change is in{transport}- once the only transport was horse and} cart. People did not go out of the dale for shopping or holidays. Today every family has at least one vehicle. { Electricity}came to the dale in the 1950's. Once there were several{shops, a cobbler and baker plus travelling shops including a banking bus. Today only a general dealers shop remains in the village and a mobile butcher calls { Farming}too is changing. Many young people prefer to farm the lower land and a lot of people have moved from the dale to find employment. Previously children wore clogs,the boys suits and girls pinafores.Today jeans, T-shirts & trainers are worn.
